status.name: Patch Available

fields.summary: Lockfiles are not being created for datanode storage directories

comments.body: It looks like this behavior was introduced by HDFS-5138.  I skimmed the comments, but I didn't see any discussion of datanode lock file changes.  As far as I can tell, the fact that locking is now disabled on the datanode was unintentional.  [~atm], [~tlipcon], [~sureshms], any perspective on this?

This message was automatically generated.

Agree, seems unintentional. It'd be pretty difficult to inadvertently start up two DNs on the same host, since they'll likely try to bind to the same RPC/HTTP/DTP ports and fail, but still seems like we should fix this anyway, if only to get rid of the warning message.
